Detailed Description

This class is designed to be a superclass of objects that represent taggable objects within a map, such as nodes, ways and relations. It saves having to implement tag handling capabilities in each class that requires it.

Member Function Documentation

void OSMTaggable::addTag ( QXmlStreamReader &  xml  ) 

Add a tag to the object. The tag is read from the QXMLStreamReader object provided. The xml reader should be positioned at a tag start element. (i.e. xml.isStartElement() && xml.name() == "tag" )

Parameters:
xml A QXMLStreamReader object at the correct position

Definition at line 12 of file osmtaggable.cpp.

Add a tag to the object. The name and value are provided as arguments.

Parameters:
name The name, or key, of the tag
value The value of the tag

Definition at line 7 of file osmtaggable.cpp.

bool OSMTaggable::hasTag ( QString  name,
QString &  value 
)

This function returns true if the object has a tag with the given name, and the value of the tag is written to value.

Parameters:
name The name of the tag to check for
value The value of the found tag is written to this QString variable
Returns:
True if the tag is found, false otherwise

QList< OSMTag > OSMTaggable::tags (  ) 

Returns a QList of all the OSMTag objects within the object.

Returns:
A QList<OSMTag> containing all the tags in the object.
